result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather M Maruna was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Heather M Maruna is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Heather M Maruna was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: **Sentence corrected from 2 years, 6 months of initial confinement to 1 year, 6 months.**

superMiscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to Probation while on Extended Supervision.  Bond of $250.00 from 15CF143 to be applied - COCC to forward funds to Probation.  Any balance remaining once discharged from ES will be reduced to a civil judgment.
Must provide DNA sample and pay a $250.00 DNA surcharge to Probation while on Extended Supervision.  Any balance remaining once discharged from ES will be reduced to a civil judgment.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.  
Not to have contact with:  Joel Bruflodt.
Must undergo COMPAS evaluation and follow through with criminogenic needs as recommended by Probation.

supervisions.notes: Must follow rules of Extended Supervision.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather M Maruna

3 CASES:  15CF341, 15CF369, 15CF143  Defendant Heather M Maruna in court with attorney Shelly Tomtschik.  Defendant Heather M Maruna in custody.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  3:10 JP-clerk    Atty Tomtschick recv'd PSI.  DA-no victims.  DA addresses Ct.  Atty Tomts addresses ct. 


SENTENCING 15CF369 - Ct - count 1 - 2 years 6 months confinement with 2 years extended supervision. Eligible for challenge incarceration.  Elig for sub abuse program.  DNA sample for each count.  DNA surcharge of $250.00.  Court Costs - $290.60.   Follow Compass evaluation.  Follow rules of probation and extended supervision.  No firearm.  Deportation.  85 days sentence credit.  No contact with Joe Bufold, subject to discretion of probation.  Fees to be paid through probation.  Unable to make probation of supervision, fees can be reduced to civil judgment.
